description: The Cooperativa Ganadera Indígena, established in the 1970s, is one of Patagonia's oldest producers' cooperatives, focusing on improving livestock marketing for small producers. With over 250 members, it supports the community by managing the marketing of wool, meat, and essential foodstuffs. The cooperative emphasizes economic justice, environmental sustainability, and social equity, aiming to enhance the livelihoods of its members while preserving their indigenous identity and traditions.
name: Cooperativa Ganadera Indígena
